#summary Installing  EasyGSP on Linux

[install_windows Windows] | Linux

==Install Java==
  # Download the latest(non-rpm) jdk from http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/
  # Create directory /opt/java
  # Move download to /opt/java
  # chmod a+x jdk-[version].bin
  # extract bin file sudo ./jdk-[version].bin
  # Create JAVA_HOME environment variable
      add the following lines to /etc/profile
      {{{
      JAVA_HOME=/opt/java/jdk1.6.0_21

      export JAVA_HOME
      export PATH=$PATH:$JAVA_HOME/bin
      }}}
  # Logout and log back in or try 
  {{{
    $ source /etc/profile
  }}}
  # Test variable
  {{{
    $ echo $JAVA_HOME
  }}}
  you should see the proper path

     

==Install LightTPD==
* Ubuntu/Debian *  

  {{{
  $ sudo apt-get install lighttpd
  }}}
* CentOS/Fedora *
  {{{
  $ sudo yum install lighttpd
  }}}

or 

follow this link for more Lighttpd install options http://redmine.lighttpd.net/projects/1/wiki/GetLighttpd

==Installing EasyGSP==
{{{
  $ cd /opt
  $ wget http://easygsp.googlecode.com/files/easygsp-0.4.5.tar.gz
  $ tar -xvf easygsp-0.4.5.tar.gz
  $ rm easygsp-0.4.5.tar.gz
  $ ln -s easygsp-0.4.5 easygsp
  $ cd easygsp/bin
  $ chmod +x start.sh
  $ cdmod +x stop.sh
}}}


* Start EasyGSP *
{{{
$ cd /opt/easygsp/bin
$ ./start.sh
}}}

or

{{{
$ sudo -E ./start.sh 
}}}

* Open browser, goto   *
  http://localhost:8085/examples

If all is well, you should see something like this:
http://easygsp.googlecode.com/files/startup-linux.png
